introduction: Apara Um, cofounder of Arise AI, discusses the evaluation space, specifically in the context of LLM systems. She shares her insights on evaluating the output and retrieval pieces of LLMs, and the importance of using LLMs as a judge.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to LLM Evaluation
content: Explanation of LLM systems and their importance in the field of AI.
Overview of the evaluation space and its significance in improving the usefulness of LLMs.
Discussion on the need for a comprehensive evaluation framework that considers both output and retrieval aspects.
Introduction to the concept of LLMs as a judge.

sections.title: Section 2: Evaluating Outputs
content: Explanation of the importance of evaluating LLM outputs.
Discussion on various metrics for evaluating LLM outputs, such as accuracy, relevance, and completeness.
Presentation of case studies demonstrating the application of these metrics in practice.
Examination of the limitations and challenges associated with evaluating LLM outputs.

sections.title: Section 3: Evaluating Retrieval
content: Explanation of the significance of evaluating LLM retrieval.
Discussion on different retrieval models and their impact on LLM performance.
Presentation of case studies demonstrating the application of retrieval models in practice.
Examination of the challenges and limitations associated with evaluating LLM retrieval.

sections.title: Section 4: LLMs as a Judge
content: Introduction to the concept of LLMs as a judge.
Explanation of how LLMs can be used to evaluate other LLMs.
Discussion on the potential benefits and limitations of using LLMs as a judge.
Presentation of case studies demonstrating the application of LLMs as a judge in practice.

sections.title: Section 5: Future Directions and Challenges
content: Overview of the current state of LLM evaluation.
Discussion on the future directions and challenges in the field of LLM evaluation.
Examination of the potential impact of emerging technologies on LLM evaluation.
Conclusion and recommendations for future research.
